meanings.definition: The quality or state of being prudish.
meanings.sent1: Her prudishnesses made her blush at the slightest mention of romance.
meanings.sent2: His prudishnesses were evident in his disapproval of revealing clothing.
meanings.sent3: Despite her prudishnesses, she couldn't help but giggle at the silly joke.
meanings.sent4: The prudishnesses of the old librarian were like a fortress against any hint of impropriety.
meanings.sent5: The prudishnesses of the town were shattered when the circus came to visit.

meanings.sent1: The prudishnesses of the young lady were seen in her refusal to wear anything above the knee.
meanings.sent2: His prudishnesses often led to awkward silences in social gatherings.
meanings.sent3: The prudishnesses of the cat trying to cover itself with a tiny leaf were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The prudishnesses of the politician were like a mask hiding his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The prudishnesses of the mountain were evident in its reluctance to reveal its hidden treasures.
